content.raw: Do you need to compare two common::Time objects converting them to double?
content.html: Do you need to compare two common::Time objects converting them to double?

content.raw: It's also nice to take into account the case of a simulation reset. This can be triggered by the GUI, for example. In this case, `_currentTime` is `<` than `this->startTime`. If that's the case, I think you also want to initialize `this->startime` to `_currentTime`.
content.html: It's also nice to take into account the case of a simulation reset. This can be triggered by the GUI, for example. In this case, _currentTime is < than this->startTime. If that's the case, I think you also want to initialize this->startime to _currentTime.

content.raw: Could you declare this method before the member variables? \(right before `model`\).
content.html: Could you declare this method before the member variables? (right before model).

content.raw: Could you move `Flash()` and `Dim()` between `SetInterval()` and the declaration of `name`? We usually declare members after methods.
content.html: Could you move Flash() and Dim() between SetInterval() and the declaration of name? We usually declare members after methods.

content.raw: Nitpick: Could you alphabetize these include?
content.html: Nitpick: Could you alphabetize these include?

update.description:
A generic flash light plugin: **FlashLightPlugin**. It accesses <light> elements under <link> and makes them to flash and dim based on the given parameters \(duration and interval\). It has TurnOn/Off functions so a plugin inherited from this class can activate flash lights without touching ~/light/modify topic, like turning on/off a bike headlight.

A demo world file: **flash\_light\_plugin\_demo.world**. A model has two links \(cylinder and box\) and each link has two lights attached on it. Based on the parameters, the lights on the cylinder keep blinking while the ones on the box are either turned off or staying constant.

Testing code:** INTEGRATION\_flash\_light\_plugin**. It is to verify that the plugin publishes correct messages to control the lights. It listens to ~/light/modify topic and measures the actual duration/interval time and the last update time of each light. It passes if the error is within 0.01 sec.
update.title: Flash light plugin
